properties.description: 25 homes designed with the Older Women’s Co-Housing group using PTE’s ‘fabric first’ approach which maximises the benefits of orientation, air-tightness, insulation and following the co-housing model. www.youtube.com/watch?v=9q25nbEl8rg
properties.name: New Ground (online only)

properties.description: A sumptuous feast of Victorian stained glass & bold sacred sculpture in what Sir John Betjeman called the 'cathedral of the Arts and Crafts movement.' Work by William Morris, Edward Burne-Jones, William Blake Richamind & Christopher Whall.
properties.name: Holy Trinity Church Sloane Square

properties.description: Magnificent Victorian cemetery with Gothic chapel & restored & ruined lodge. One of London's wildest cemeteries. Part restored with the help of a lottery grant. 52 acres of woodland, with bats, owls, foxes & squirrels. Grade II*  landscape.
properties.name: Nunhead Cemetery

properties.description: Unique example of Expressionist architecture in London with sculptural staircase based on organic plant forms. Grade II listed. New cafe area and renovations in 2008. Refurbishment of theatre and foyer 2020.
properties.name: Rudolf Steiner House

properties.description: A close of 13 self-built houses. Each is unique, built using method developed by Walter Segal, who led the project in the 1980s. Houses have been extended and renovated. Sustainable features including solar electric, water & space heating.
properties.name: Walter Segal Self-build Houses

properties.description: 6-storey building featuring a Western exterior and traditional Islamic interior, modelled on the Blue Mosque in Istanbul. Has dome and minaret tower.
properties.name: Suleymaniye Mosque

properties.description:
"ARGENTINA AT THE LONDON DESIGN FESTIVAL 2022" 
During Open House Festival people will have the unique opportunity to visit and explore the historic mansion host to the exhibition “Creative experience- From Argentina to the world”
properties.name: Argentine Ambassador's Residence

properties.description:
Grade II listed building from 1889 with diverse historical functions - now functioning as Theatre venue and dance studios.
A more recent remodelling and additional dance studios has made the complex a bright and contemporary venue.
properties.name: The Place

properties.description: A unique II* listed Italianate church by John Dando Sedding with attached Campanile and Institute Building. Of particular significance in the church is the imposing baldacchino over the High Altar, which dominates the east end.
properties.name: The Church of Our Most Holy Redeemer

properties.description: Grade II Modernist House designed by German emigre architect Rudolf Frankel for his sister and family in 1938. The house remains relatively intact and retains the layout and original features which adhere to Modernist principles of the era.
properties.name: 1 Halsbury Close

properties.description: Grade ll* early 18C mansion.  Unique panelled dining room from the Chateau de Bercy, 18C Dutch wall paintings and  exquisite original plaster ceiling and Grade ll Temple shaped folly  by James 'Athenian' Stuart. .  Golf Club from 1894.ple s
properties.name: Camden Place (Chislehurst Golf Club)

properties.description: Founded in 11C, with Jacobean memorial c1615. Burial site of 5 Archbishops of Canterbury.
properties.name: Church of St Mary the Blessed Virgin

properties.description: Medieval Parish Church, 15C, enlarged & rebuilt in 19C. Shingle spire 1857, by Wollaston. Chancel by Ferrey, lengthened with East wall by Bodley & Garner. Scadbury Chapel (Walsingham tombs), with rood screen. Clock by Dent, 1858.
properties.name: St Nicholas Church, Chislehurst

properties.description: One of a pair of modern houses on a sensitive site in a conservation area. A triple-height staircase atrium brings light into the heart of the house and ground floor areas open onto courtyard gardens on three sides.
properties.name: Springbank

properties.description: Tree-lined housing estate on the ridge of Central Hill & Crystal Palace, incorporating open spaces, views over London, gardens and sense of community. Rosemary Stjernstedt Ted Hollamby Adrian Sansom, Lambeth Borough Architects 1963.
properties.name: Central Hill Estate

properties.description: The operational factory of Kaymet, a maker of trays and trolleys since 1947. A hidden 1950s building with a small yard, originally a printing works. It is brick built, with clear-storey glazing and tubular truss north-light main shed roof.
properties.name: Kaymet Factory

properties.description: Two railway arches have been repurposed into a ceramic studio.
properties.name: Turning Earth Ceramics Hoxton - E2

properties.description: Ceramics centre for the Lee Valley, covering the entire top floor of an old hardware factory. Three rooms, providing just over 8000 sq ft of floor space; the main room is capped by its original saw-tooth glass roof feature.
properties.name: Turning Earth Ceramics Leyton - E10

properties.description:
Victorian Potting sheds converted to artists' studios set within the grounds of Grade II listed Cannizaro Park.
The eight resident artists will be displaying their work during the festival at these unique studios.
properties.name: Cannizaro Studios

properties.description: The Small Beer Brewery was founded in 2017 by James Grundy and  Felix James. It is the first of its kind, specialising in brewing world class beer at a sociable strength.
properties.name: Small Beer Brewery

properties.description: Unit used as an art studio in a small industrial estate.
properties.name: Cut Glass Studio Ltd, Tottenham Hale

properties.description:
London is known for its rooftops. The Roof Garden at The Post Building has been designed as a one-off location for enjoyment, work and wellness looking out over some of its most memorable.

Open to the public 7 days a week!
properties.name: The Post Building

properties.description: The museum is situated in a shopfront in Leegate Shopping Centre, which has been described by the Evening Standard as "the worst shopping precinct in the country."
properties.name: Museum of Neoliberalism

properties.description: Street Art and Murals can be found in many places across London. They are artistic expressions that can be challenging, thought provoking, funny or beautiful. We will explore the area of Brixton and see the art that celebrates a community.
properties.name: Local discoveries: Street Art in Brixton – a virtual tour with a London Blue Badge Tourist Guide

properties.description: A 4-mile outdoor walking tour taking in a variety of Wimbledon's greater and lesser known buildings, led by Ramblers group, the Metropolitan Walkers. Includes Wimbledon Village, and several buildings new to the tour this year.
properties.name: Wimbledon architecture walk

properties.description: Antepavilion Commission offers emerging architects and makers opportunities to create new work through hands-on construction. Works are put on temporary display in Columbia/ Brunswick Wharf, situated on the Regents Canal in Haggerston.
properties.name: Hoxton Docks

properties.description:
Semi-detached residential 2-bed house totally refurbished by the owner-architect.
The main works included demolition of str. walls to achieve open plan living, new bathrooms, kitchen, porch, windows, green roof, UFH and insulation.
properties.name: 186A Uxbridge Road

properties.description: The Family Kitchen & Shop, Royal Botanic Gardens Kew, designed by architects HOK with front of house interiors by Mizzi Studio and Lumsden Design, is an environmentally driven, education-led food space for visitors of all ages.
properties.name: The Family Kitchen, Royal Botanic Gardens Kew

properties.description: The Boleyn is a prominent landmark at a crossroads right by the former West Ham football ground. It is an exuberant piece of French-style Renaissance architecture built in 1899-1900 and reopened in June 2021 after a spectacular restoration.
properties.name: The Boleyn Tavern

properties.description:
The Serpentine Coffee House overlooking the Serpentine Lake designed by Mizzi Studio, with its undulating brass canopy roof that echoes a stingray’s flight through water,  has added a
new architectural landmark to London’s Hyde Park.
properties.name: The Serpentine Coffee House, The Royal Parks, Opposite The Serpentine Gallery

properties.description: The former Alexandra Palace Railway Station now run by a charity for use by local people and organisations for classes, meetings and many other leisure activities.
properties.name: CUFOS - Community Use For the Old Station

properties.description: The new ceramics studio occupies the top floor of a beautiful old saw-toothed factory building within the Crawley Road industrial estate, one of several new creative businesses joining the area
properties.name: Turning Earth Ceramics Haringey - N22

properties.description: Former indoor garden design workshop converted into a open-access ceramics studio.
properties.name: Turning Earth Ceramics Highgate - N6

properties.description: The Copper Coffee House is a combination of neo-futuristic form and innovative use of copper that results in a functioning café that acts a work of public sculpture.
properties.name: Copper Coffee House

properties.description:
A plain Victorian Church set in a wooded Churchyard, with a vibrant and striking set of Murals around the altar and the Choir. 
Has indoor toilet facilities. 
A good quality well used organ in good condition, and an excellent accoustic
properties.name: St Mary's Church Bromley

properties.description: A Grade II listed motor garage and petrol station built in the style of a Japanese pagoda in 1928. Now a Tesco Express.
properties.name: "Chinese" Garage

properties.description: Altab Ali Park was renamed in 1998 after a murdered 25-year-old Bangladeshi Sylheti clothing worker. Formerly known as St. Mary's Park, it is the site of the old 14 C white church, St. Mary Matfelon which gave Whitechapel its name.
properties.name: Altab Ali Park

properties.description: A revolutionary first-of-its-kind opening bridge. Powered by nothing but hand winches, this 12 tonne weathering steel and oak structure playfully rolls and inverts to allow boats to pass from river to dock.
properties.name: Rolling Bridge
